interpretation_summary: The replication aimed to test whether Post-secular respondents were less likely than Traditional respondents to affirm human evolution in GSS 2006/2008/2010. The preregistered plan specified computing class-specific proportions and fitting a logistic regression with Traditional as the reference. The code implemented this plan (including optional weighted GLM), but execution failed at data import: pandas could not read the Stata v110 file and pyreadstat could not be reliably imported/used inside the container despite Dockerfile updates and in-script installation attempts. No results were produced; thus, the focal hypothesis could not be tested.

fidelity_assessment.method_alignment: Planned and executed code aligned conceptually with the preregistration: unweighted logistic regression of evol_binary ~ C(class_norm) with Traditional as reference, class-specific proportions, and optional weighted GLM if weights detected. The main deviation arose from data I/O failures preventing model estimation.

deviations.issue_description: Inability to read the Stata dataset (v110) via pandas; fallback to pyreadstat failed due to ModuleNotFoundError and runtime import issues.
deviations.impact: High: Blocked all downstream analysis; no estimates or outputs were produced.

deviations.issue_description: On-the-fly pip install of pyreadstat within the script and repeated Docker rebuilds to include build tools and pyreadstat.
deviations.impact: Medium: Environment workarounds deviated from a stable preregistered environment but were attempts to enable data access; they did not alter the planned statistical analysis.

results_comparison.hypothesis_tested: Respondents with a post-secular perspective will be less likely than respondents with a traditional perspective to respond that humans evolved from other animals.
results_comparison.original_results: Original claim reports a 3 percentage-point lower endorsement for Post-secular vs Traditional (p < 0.05, two-tailed).
results_comparison.replication_results: No replication estimates available. The analysis did not run due to data import failures (Stata v110 incompatibility and pyreadstat import issues). No proportions, coefficients, or p-values were produced.
results_comparison.overall_answer: No. The replication could not execute the preregistered comparison due to data loading failures; thus, the hypothesis was not tested.

replication_report: Replication not completed: Data import failures (Stata v110 compatibility and pyreadstat import issues) prevented estimation of the Post-secular vs Traditional difference on the evolution item; no results were generated.

failure_handling.suggestions: Provide the dataset as CSV (GSSreplication.csv) or re-export the Stata file to a supported version (e.g., v114+). Alternatively, include a small data dictionary and a minimal CSV subset containing the evolution and class variables for testing.

Pin and preinstall pyreadstat in the Docker build using a manylinux wheel; avoid in-script pip installs. Ensure system build tools are present (build-essential, zlib1g-dev, libbz2-dev). Add an explicit pyreadstat fallback try/except with a post-install import retry before proceeding. If issues persist, add an R-based fallback (haven::read_dta) with reticulate/command call to convert to CSV.

notes: The replication plan and code matched the preregistration conceptually, including unweighted and optional weighted analyses. However, dataset I/O blocked execution. Once data access is resolved (CSV or compatible .dta), the script should produce class-specific proportions and the focal logistic regression as planned. Consider verifying variable names for the evolution item and class membership after data conversion and re-running sensitivity checks (weighted vs unweighted).
